intro: Narcissus fernandesii, commonly known as the Fernandes' daffodil, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers with a distinctive orange center. The plant features strap-like leaves that are broad and grass-like in appearance. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
